djangotailoring.accounts.views¶

Views¶

djangotailoring.accounts.views.login(*args, **kwargs)¶

A clone of django.contrib.auth.views.login that uses djangotailoring.accounts.forms.EmailAuthenticationForm rather than the standard form. See the official Django documentation for the behavior and arguments of this function.

djangotailoring.accounts.views.validate_access_code(request, redirect_url=None, template_name='accounts/accesscodelogin.html')¶
Parameters:
  • request (a Django HttpRequest object) – the current request
  • redirect_url (a string) – the url to redirect to on successful login, if None then it is presumed to be ‘/’
  • template_name (a string or list of strings) – the name of the template to use for rendering the page

A simple view that handles login via djangotailoring.accounts.forms.AccessCodeForm.
